Visions of the Vault: Monthly Magic Items V

226649.name: Changeling: The Dreaming (20th Anniversary Edition)
226649.description:
From the introduction:

Everyone dreams. Everyone looks at the world and thinks about how it could be better. Whether you’ve watched the news and wished crooked cops weren’t so untouchable, or wished you were riding a griffin into battle to save your one true love instead of grinding out some mindless drudgery at work, everyone imagines a better world.

Changing the world starts with dreams, with imagining something better, something more. Imagining something that’s not as miserable as what really exists, or imagining something amazing almost entirely divorced from reality gladdens the heart and makes the world a little bit better, even if only for a little while. The world tries to pound away at those dreams and replace them with boring, banal reality. Someone that dreams “too big,” as if there was such a thing, hears that they need to focus on what’s real, and not their fantasies. It’s just as dangerous, though, to dream too little. The world isn’t just a drab mire of darkness and misery, it has hope and love and all the other things that the best dreams are made of. It’s just a matter of finding it.

That’s Changeling: The Dreaming.

226650.name: Wrech-A-Mecha
226650.description:
In Wreck­-A-­Mecha players build a giant robot (Mecha) from a randomly assigned Head and Core part along with arms and legs from their decks. Destroying opponent parts earns you victory
points and the first to gain 10 points wins. A core will get you all 10 points, but it's hard to hit. This is because one of the actions players can perform in a turn is to use an arm to defend, forcing an attack to target it instead of anything else (until it is hit).

Since you are only able to take 3 actions per turn, managing your offense and defense is key to survival. And with a weapon triangle causing weaknesses and resistances along with tons of unique special abilities for each part, you'll need to install parts strategically to get the upper hand.

With designs taking inspiration from Mecha anime and video games, Wreck­-A-­Mecha let’s you live out your Mecha customization fantasies in a quick 15­-30 minute game. It’s easy to learn, yet strategic. And with a second copy, the game can be expanded from a head to head brawl into a 2-­on-­2 team battle.

226651.name: Nations of Théah: Volume 1
226651.description:
From the back of the book:

Liberty! Equality! Freedom!

Change is coming to Théah’s western nations. Tensions rise as disenfranchised, war-weary people grow restless under the unrelenting rule of the nobility. Now, the people look towards revolution as the only respite.

This book contains material for 7th Sea: Second Edition including new Backgrounds, Advantages, Dueling styles and new monsters. It also includes expanded setting information for Théah’s four western nations.

Avalon, including a look at Queen Elaine’s Court, the Sidhe, various locations in the Glamour Isles and an expansion on Glamour Sorcery
Castille, including an inside view into the Church and Inquisition, the ducados of Castille and Alquimia, an all new Sorcery for Castille
Montaigne, including a look into the royal family and l’Empereur’s court, the Montaigne countryside and an expansion on Porté Sorcery
Vestenmennavenjar, including a look into the Vendel League, the jarls of Vesten, the ongoings of the various cities in Vesten and Galdr, an all new Sorcery for Vesten




Adventure, political intrigue and upheaval lurks around every corner. Are you ready to take up the cause?

226652.name: Cluckles' Adventure
226652.description:
Cluckles may be small, but she is feisty and brave. Guide her through 100+ challenging levels to rescue the chicks and defeat the evil minions!

Source: The Game Website.

226653.name: Getaway Island
226653.description:
Getaway Island is a visual novel where your decisions determine your outcome. Perhaps you'll find the love of your life, or maybe you will return home a loyal man. This decision is yours to make. Maybe being stranded isn't so bad. We hope you enjoy your stay on Getaway Island!

Source: The Developer Website.

226654.name: The Safeguard Garrison 2
226654.description:
User Summary

Ready you turrets, plant your mines and be prepared. This time you are to defend The Sowali Swamps and The Magmaro Mountains.

226655.name: Gingerdead House: Star S'mores
226655.description:
In a galaxy far, far away...

The battle to protect your Gingerbread House from being devoured by fairy-tale monsters wages on! Star Smores is an all new expansion for the board game, Gingerdead House.

Star Smores features
5 New Defenses
4 New Monsters
1 New Action

226656.name: Hunahpu: way of the Warrior
226656.description:
User Summary

Mix and match different types of weapons, items, and build a sequence of actions.

226657.name: Twist of Destiny
226657.description:
User Summary

Twist of Destiny is an exciting turn-based RPG where you lead a team of up to 4 characters around the world.

226658.name: A Gummy's Life
226658.description:
Warning! In A Gummy’s Life, gummies have come to life… And they are unmanageable! Choose your favorite gummy among a great variety, customize it to your taste and enjoy playing and laughing with your friends or your family. Show who is in charge of the sugar!

Source: The Game Website.

226659.name: Sons of Triskelion
226659.description:
Another classic RPG from Warfare Studios! Enter the merciless world of gladiators! Can you be the king of the Arena?

Source: The Game Website.

226660.name: Shock Tactics
226660.description:
Shock Tactics is a single player turn-based sci-fi strategy game with tactical combat, exploration, squad management and base building.

Source: The Game Website.

226661.name: Adventuring gentleman
226661.description:
Adventuring Gentleman is a steampunk roguelite platform shooter where you can go on a number ofadventures offered by your clubhouse members. Each adventure consists of procedurally generated floor with enemy wave sequences unique tothe chosen adventure. Each adventure has three difficulty.

Source: The Game Website.

226662.name: Cucumber Blues
226662.description:
He lost the most preciuos thing he`ve ever had - his family. And now his only purpose is revenge. He`ll slide through Corn Mafia`s foes, squads of corrupted authorities and the entire cartel of fertilizers just to neatly put a bullet in the killer`s head.

Source: The Game Website.

226663.name: Endless Horde
226663.description:
The horde is here to eat your brain and murder every single one of your scientists. Gather your forces, this is the last stand before we lose the facility! Place guards, close doors, and position traps. Survive as long as you can!

Source: The Game Website.

226664.name: Japanese Women - Animated Jigsaws
226664.description:
User Summary

"Animated Jigsaws" is a jigsaw puzzle game with videos instead of pictures.

226665.name: Cryptocracy
226665.description:
Cryptocracy is a game that can make you sit up and take a notice about how our modern society is organized and who really runs it. If you have no problem with imagination, the game can show you who is behind the curtain…

Source: The Game Website.

226666.name: Fluffy Creatures VS The World
226666.description:
Fluffy Creatures VS The World is a simple platforming indie game that puts the player in control of Fluffy McCuddleston, a member of a peaceful, intellectual race. Can you save yourself and the entire Fluffyland?

Source: The Developer Website.

226667.name: Creekside Creep Invasion
226667.description:
Stop the bogus creeps in this hardcore deliberately paced Halloween themed action roguelite! Equip rad perk based armor in five slots, wear and unlock new gnarly costumes with active and passive abilities, use tubular randomized guns and unlock tons of new ammo types and upgrade your awesome mini-mart!

Source: The Game Website.

226668.name: Battle for Enlor
226668.description:
Battle for Enlor is a turn-based tactical combat game. Demons, Undead and the most terrifying creatures are taking over the kingdom and is up to you to assemble a party to defeat them! Join forces with over 8 unique characters and battle the most powerful foes you have ever faced!

Source: The Developer Website.

226669.name: Hot Plates
226669.description:
User Summary

The Chef of a space-restaurant needs to know all about management and how to satisfy his customers personal taste.

226670.name: Spark the Electric Jester
226670.description:
https://www.facebook.com/sparktej/

Spark the electric jester is an action/platformer video game heavily based on best classics from the 16-bit era from both sides of the isle.

226671.name: The Hunted
226671.description:
The Fugitive, Rambo and X-Files come together in this homage to the classic arcade gun games from Namco (Time Crisis) and Sega (House of the Dead). Atmospheric and immersive with full on fire fights, an 'on the rails' story, shoot, duck to take cover, reload, raise hell! Built exclusively for VR.

Source: The Developer Website.

226672.name: Rumpus
226672.description:
Hosted by the ever-charismatic Mr. Rumpus and inspired by the golden age of couch multiplayer, Rumpus is a fast-paced arcade action game for up to 4 players!

Source: The Game Website.

226673.name: Solaright
226673.description:
User Summary

Complete the electrical circuit on a cube in jigsaw fashion to light up the tree!

226674.name: The Wild Eternal
226674.description:
Get lost beneath the fog in The Wild Eternal, a reflective first-person exploration game. Embark on a meditative journey to heal the scars of your past. Can you escape the cycle of reincarnation?

Source: The Game Website.

226675.name: Ready for Take off - A320 Simulator
226675.description:
Without doubt flying virtual aircraft from your PC is one of the most interesting simulations – at the same time, it is one with a very steep learning curve. Ready for Take off, though, makes it especially easy to relive the last holiday trip from the cockpit’s view, even for less experienced PC pilots.

Source: The Game Website.

226676.name: Kingdom of Loot
226676.description:
Inspired by the classic 16-bit ARPGs of last decades, KINGDOM·OF·LOOT is a love child.

Source: The Game Website.

226677.name: Soma Spirits: Rebalance
226677.description:
User Summary

Guide Heart and Soul, the guardian spirits of Soma, through a divided realm in a colorful RPG adventure where your choices decide the fate of the world.

226678.name: Cyborg Tower Defense
226678.description:
Futuristic 3D Tower Defense Game where evil Cyborgs try to take over the space ship Andromeda deck by deck. Zoom right into the action and glide over the surface to see the spectacular weapons and explosions at your disposal. Kill 'em all!

Source: The Developer Website.

226679.name: Cat Meat
226679.description:
Meteors are raining down and your loved ones are at home alone! Race back to make sure they're safe, but be careful - cats only have 9 lives!

Source: The Developer Website.

226680.name: Steampunk Syndicate
226680.description:
Steampunk Syndicate is a tower defense with elements of collectible card games.

Source: The Developer Website.

226681.name: The Town With No Name
226681.description:
User Summary

Gameplay consists of two modes a standard point and click interface usually with multiple options presented onscreen with a short animated scene following what decision the player has made. The other mode of the game is a light gun game played with the Amiga CDs' gamepad, or mouse and take out multiple villains not unlike Mad Dog McRee.

The Story of The Town with No Name involves "The Man With No Name" getting of a train at the station in the Town with No Name where he is immediately greeted with gunfire in a lightgun sequence. Once the miscreant is dispatched it is learned that the man the player just killed was "Evil Eb's Littlest brother" and the Evil Eb will gather up his posse and kill the player. The player then travel throughout the town in order to find and dispatch Evil Eb's posse while playing an assortment of mini-games, falling off balconies instead of taking the stairs, and collecting baked beans (425 of them to be exact). Once Evil Eb's posse is disposed of the player faces off against Evil Eb in a final showdown, once the player has beaten Evil Eb, Eb asks the player to kill him in a case of mistaken identity and they wind up friends in the end over a bottle of whiskey.

226682.name: Deemo
226682.description:
User Summary

Deemo is a piano music rhythm video game.

226683.name: ATV Renegades
226683.description:
User Summary

Prepare yourself for extreme air and jaw-dropping showmanship in this nitro-charged, ATV racing experience.

226684.name: Late Shift
226684.description:
Late Shift is a high stakes FMV crime thriller. Forced into a brutal London heist, you must choose your own adventure in this interactive cinematic experience with adaptable storylines that lead to one of seven conclusions. Your decisions are you.

Source: The Developer Website.

226685.name: ESSENCE
226685.description:
In this surreal non-violent exploration adventure you are in a world you don’t remember seeing before at a place forgotten by time and space. Wake up and explore this miraculous world that has been waiting for your return so long.

Source: The Developer Website.

226686.name: False Shelter
226686.description:
User Summary

False Shelter is a survival adventure game in which the player takes the role of the young Gaspare Emidio, whose employer suddenly fell ill, and who now has to survive in the wilderness with people whom he doesn't know or trust.

226687.name: 'n Verlore Verstand
226687.description:
Be prepared to be transported to a reality of dreams and nightmares. What will you discover about yourself in this journey through the subconscious?

Source: The Developer Website.

226688.name: DON'T CRASH GO
226688.description:
Move left and right to change lanes, collect coins, and avoid a crash at all costs. Addictive and fun for everyone!

Source: The Publisher Website.

226690.description:
Included with "The Investigators of Arkham Horror" book pre-order.

Three preview cards for Arkham Horror: The Card Game — a Marie Lambeau investigator card and her two signature cards. These allow you to enjoy the game as Marie Lambeau prior to the investigator's normal release.
226690.name: Arkham Horror: The Card Game – Marie Lambeau
boardgamefamily: Arkham Horror: The Card Game LCG

226693.name: Three Cheers For Master: Bookmark of Literal Undermining
226693.description:
A promo extension give away in special event

As a Play, split an entire tower in two by at least one card space inbetween. You can't play a card in that space. Leave the bookmark in place until the game ends.

The victim keeps the bookmark until next game !

226694.name: The Star Raiders
226694.description:
From publisher blurb:

In a galaxy in upheaval, heroes are found in unlikely places. That’s certainly the case for the crew of the Marauder, who have become known—and wanted—in the Stellar Imperium and the Grue Unity for their involvement in recent events. Some within the Republic Alliance call the Star Raiders heroes; others dismiss them as pirates, mercenaries, or renegades. In truth, they are all of those things and more.

Designed to mesh nicely with our Cosmic Handbook sourcebook for Mutants & Masterminds, the Star Raiders are a band of ready-made rogues and swashbucklers ready to ply the spaceways as rivals in your cosmic adventures, or as a ready-made band of intergalactic heroes!

226695.name: Chronicles of Darkness: Dark Eras Companion
226695.description:
From publisher blurb:

Always Another Secret

The Chronicles of Darkness stretch back to the beginning of human civilization, and perhaps further. When people fearfully peered into the darkness past their campfires, the Begotten were looking back. When they opened their mouths and spoke, attaching sound to meaning, the Awakened bound those words in power and light. When humanity was forming tribes, werewolves were communing with their totem spirits. When the first cities arose, the undead licked their lips in hunger.

And through it all, forces larger and more dangerous than the whole of humanity worked their dire machinations. Even these forces, though, are subject to the tides of history.

The Weight of Time

The Dark Eras Companion presents eleven new Eras for the Chronicles of Darkness. Stretching from Ancient Rome and Egypt through the Black Death, the Thirty Years War, the Reconstruction, and the Russian Revolution, the Companion showcases even more of the secret history of this eldritch world. Included in each era are “snapshots” of the various supernatural creatures, including vampires, changelings, mummies, and demons. Also included are lists of inspirational media to help you put these Eras in context for your troupe.

Open the Dark Eras Companion and take another look back in time.

The Dark Eras Companion continues where Chronicles of Darkness: Dark Eras began and was made possible by the backers of the Dark Eras Kickstarter campaign.

226696.name: The Devil's Due: Artifacts of the Black Freighter
226696.description:
From publisher blurb:

PIRATE NATIONS gives a few examples of ‘rewards’ for those willing to sacrifice flesh and soul to the Devil Jonah. However, some GMs may wish to have a plethora of options to tempt their players further down the path of damnation. The Devil Jonah freely gives these to those brave or foolish enough to offer themselves willingly. After all, even the bravest Heroes can only give so much before they fall to Villainy. Inside is a list of sample artifacts, plus a short guide to creating your own dark relics to seduce your Heroes into sacrificing their very souls with. The Black Freighter awaits you!

226697.name: Razor Sharp Dalliance: Fans for Love and War in Théah
226697.description:
From publisher blurb:

Both men and women of good breeding carry fans in Théah. But they are more than just a fire guard or a way to keep cool in the heat of a ballroom. Fans can be an essential item of fashion and also a means to communicate secret assignations. But only if you know the right code…

226698.name: Hearts and Harlots: Prostitution and the Jenny's Guild in Théah
226698.description:
From publisher blurb:

The oldest profession is practiced from one end of Théah to the other. While the lot of a working girl is a little better in Théah than it is in our world, it is still a minefield of danger and scandal that few but the desperate choose. But a clever Jenny who knows how to leverage the secrets she learns in the bedroom can do well for herself if she knows which strings to pull.

Note: This supplement steers away from any graphic content, focusing on a very fictional and more romantic swashbuckling version of prostitution, but given the subject matter reader discretion is advised.

226699.name: AEGIS Interplanetary Guidebook
226699.description:
From publisher blurb:

Rockets and Rayguns and Matrians... OH MY!

When the Elder Martians invaded Britain in 1894, they weren’t prepared for utter defeat. Nor that Britain would reverse-engineer their technology and spark a space race in the 1930s!

While Allied rockets powered by alien crystals explore the solar system and A.E.G.I.S. still holds the line against evil of every kind, a new threat - the Third Reich - has extended its grasp into space, using demonic technology & sinister weapons!

This supplement for the Airship Daedalus RPG has everything you need to add some classic sci-fi to your retro-pulp adventure:

New Worlds!
Hollow Moon - Venus - Mars - Planet X

Alien Species!
Selenite - Lunari - Red Martian - many more!

Alien Creatures!
New Vehicles & Weapons!
including rockets, saucers and 21 types of raygun!

New NPCs!
including space pirates and Nazi werewolves!

Much More!
Alien PC rules - Mission briefings - Planetary maps




92 full-color pages including vintage style advertisements for extra immersion!

226700.name: Reaper of the Returned
226700.description:
From publisher blurb:

All living things must die. The multiverse is a fantastical place filled with wonder and mystery, but that one fact is true across all the planes. Not that heroes or adventurers are concerned, since surviving party members can just track down a cleric who will resurrect them for a generous donation to the temple. But such actions have consequences, even upsetting the delicate cosmic structure of reality.

And when that happens, a reaper arrives to balance the scales.

Reapers don't care if a hero is good or evil. They aren't moved by pleading, bargaining, or curses. It's not even clear if they can be killed, since the few who claim to have survive a reaper tend to die a few short years later. All that matters to them is restoring the cosmic order of life and death.

You can hide behind protective spells. Move from one safe house to another. Perhaps even challenge them to personal combat (which they'll gleefully accept). But one way or another, the reaper earns its due. It's just a question of when.

226701.name: Gear Heart
226701.description:
From publisher blurb:

Every three years, on the night of the winter solstice, a mysterious tower appears deep within the haunted Ringwood forest. Disappearing before sunrise, its close proximity to the University of Scarthey is an unsettling enigma.

Archchancellor Gwydion Ambrosius has called upon you and other Rector agents to investigate. What will you find inside?

Gear Heart is an adventure short compatible with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game and designed for 1st to 5th-level characters (Tier 1–5; Subtiers 1–2 and 4–5). It includes a location map. The Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Bestiary 3 is required for play.

226702.name: The Elder God Diary 3/11
226702.description:
From the introduction:

Turning into a good client. They think a (different) group of religious fanatics are going to revive some ancient god. Takes one fanatic to know another one I guess. They want me to see if they have the items needed for the ritual and retrieve them. So I'm looking for three items: Dagger of Dawn, Mirror of Daylight, Amulet of Dusk. Well, I got one of them... it's a start!

226703.name: Grossdeutschlands Stadtespiel
226703.description:
This 1940 geographical word game was designed to teach Germans the names of cities within the boundaries of the recently expanded Third Reich.

The rules booklet includes the names of each major city together with a representative drawing, sometimes with a coat of arms or other symbol, and a short verse about the city. The game board features only the illustrations and symbols for each city, not the names. Players are encouraged to read the booklet before starting the game.

The stock of small red and black letter tiles is placed in a bag or opaque bowl, and players take turns drawing blind, one tile at a time until a red letter tile is drawn. The player drawing the red tile must place it as the initial letter of one of the cities. After that, the player may place as many black letters in his hand as possible that continue the spelling of any city name that has been started with a red letter.

Play then passes to the left. Each player in turn first draws another tile from the stock and then places as many letters as possible. If a player draws a red letter, he must place it immediately. If he is unable to identify a suitable city, he must place the letter in front of him, after which the first player to call "Halt" may take and play the letter, and then continue his turn. Play then passes left from the seizing player.

Players must continue to draw a letter at the beginning of each turn, even if they have no tiles left. The winner is the player who first uses up all his tiles after the last tile has been drawn from the stock.

The map board includes Vienna, Graz, Prague and the major cities of occupied Poland as German, but still shows Denmark as independent, meaning it was based on the borders as they stood between October 1939 and April 1940.

226704.name: WARLOCK: Rules for the Universe of 1999 - 2000
226704.description:
From the introduction:

Several years ago, the first copies of a new game called Dungeons and Dragons appeared on the market. Fantasy fans and gamers in general were enthralled at the possibilities. Most of them became hooked on the game, due to its unusual and imaginative nature. You could actually do unusual things: slay dragons, rescue the downtrodden, and just grab loot.

When our group first started playing the game, our overall reaction was that it had great ideas, "but maybe we should change the combat system, clarify the Magic, and redo the monsters". Warlock is not intended to replace D&D, and, indeed would not exist without that classic game. What we have tried to do is present a way of expanding D&D without the contradictions and loopholes inherent in the original rules and with various supplements.

User summary:

The item is available as a single (combined) PDF file, or as separate files in PDF and/or DOC format, including:


Title Page
Introduction
Combat Rules
Cleric Rules
Magic User Rules
Illusionist Rules
Spellsinger Rules
Thievish Rules
Stronghold / Hireling Rules
Magic Item Rules
Character Sheets (print-and-play)
Expedition Report (print-and-play)
Known/Research Lists (print-and-play)

226705.name: Dice Tracks
226705.description:
Roll those dice and draw some tracks!

Your goal is to connect all cities and towns, by drawing your tracks in 13 turns.

You can upgrade cities and towns, gain new dice and take loans in this 15 minute game.

You need a printed out map, a pen/pencil, 6 10-sided dice and 2 markers (wooden cubes).

Will you be able expand your network in time?

226706.name: Playbooks for Farflung
226706.description:
User summary:

The Playbooks for Farflung contents are included, verbatim, in Farflung, pp. 38 - 85. They also are made available as separate files to facilitate easy print-and-play use. The separate files are black-and-white (graysacle or printer-friendly). They are provided in two minor formats:


Legal size for one-sided printing
Legal size for duplex printing, with rules reference on reverse

226707.name: Character Sheet for Farflung
226707.description:
User summary:

The Character Sheet for Farflung is provided in two minor formats - legal size, and letter size. They are black-and-white blank character sheets, intended for print-and-play use.

Note these separate character sheets are essentially identical, save formatting, to the color version presented in Farflung.

226708.name: IHRA Professional Drag Racing 2005
226708.description:
Rear of the case:

From the creators of the most successful drag racing games in the world comes the next generation of drag racing action - IHRA Professional Drag Racing 2005. IHRA Pro takes the best-selling series to a new level with its outstanding graphics, realistic physics, presentation, and, most importantly, intense racing action.

226709.name: The Biggest Loser Challenge
226709.description:
You've watched the show…NOW it's your turn.

One of the leading interactive health and fitness video games is back with The Biggest Loser Challenge.

Special Features

• Players will now enjoy more than 125 exercise moves in four different environments as well as choose from 10 pre-set fitness programs or customize their own!
• Players will be provided encouragement and given tips from trainers Bob Harper and Jillian Michaels, as well as show host Alison Sweeney and more than 70 former contestants.

Source: The Publisher Website.

226710.name: Ninth World Bestiary 2
226710.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Ninth World Bestiary 2 gives you over 160 new ones to populate your campaign. Creatures undreamt of by even the most experienced pursuer of the numenera: the huge, burrowing mimus; the six-mouthed jreet; the mirror-faced cyclic raider; and many, many more.

226711.name: The Networks: Executives
226711.description:
The Networks: Executives, a full expansion for The Networks, changes the gameplay in a few ways.

First, the players all choose a Network Executive at the start of the game. Each Network Executive has their own advantages and drawbacks.

Second, there is a new deck of Show Cards with a different mix of Genres. Each Genre now has an equal chance of appearing, unlike in the base game where Reality and Sports shows were less common. However, Sports Shows now have a higher upkeep, and Reality Shows don't get you as many Viewers on average as another Show with a bunch of Stars.

Third, players no longer automatically get starting Public Access Shows, Stars, or Ads. Instead there is a starting "Season 0" draft in which players pick their starting TV shows. These starting Shows determine a player's starting resources, like Stars, Ads, and extra money.

Fourth, the 5-Show Genre Bonus is now different. It now works just like the 3-Show Genre Bonus, plus you get to choose a Power Card. These Power Cards are named appropriately; they will give you a huge point boost!

rpgitemversion: Guardians of Galaxy XXX PDF Version
226712.name: Guarding Galaxy XXX
226712.description:
From publisher blurb:

Guarding Galaxy XXX is a quick and dirty taste of what it's like living in 2269, a kind of 70's retro-future fueled by boobs barely covered by skin-tight silver spandex and scaly bounty hunter scum packing serious heat... I'm talking about blasters, obviously.

Give this fast-paced, gonzo adventure a test drive and see why the comedy / porn-parody-in-space sub-genre deserves a look.

226713.name: The Dragon: A Fellowship Expansion Pack
226713.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dragons represent strength. They have the power to save the world. Dragons represent wisdom. They have the foresight to save the world. Dragons represent greed. They do not want to save the world if nothing is in it for them.

So they won't. Instead, I will. I have been gifted their power and named their champion. I am here to save the world on their behalf. I will do what they have decided is beneath them, and I will become glorious.

This Overlord is my stepping stone. Their war and their plans amount to nothing before the fire of the dragons. We will defeat them. We will destroy them. And I will take my place in history as the greatest champion this world has ever seen.

I am the Dragon, champion of fire. And my enemies will burn.

The Dragon is the second Fellowship expansion pack, and it is not too different from the playbooks in the core game. The Dragon is a champion of fire. The Dragon may be a literal dragon, or The Dragon may be a title they hold. The one thing all dragons have in common is an affinity for fire and dangerous skill in melee combat.

The Dragon has more customization than any other playbook. While other playbooks have 2-4 Core Moves and choose 2 Custom Moves, the Dragon has 1 Core Move and chooses 4 Custom Moves during character creation. This gives the Dragon a wide variety of different things they can do reasonably well, but they won't improve upon a core kit of abilities like other playbooks do. If you want an expanding bag of cool tricks at your disposal, The Dragon is the playbook for you.

226714.name: The Remnant: A Fellowship Expansion Pack
226714.description:
From publisher blurb:

My people are dead. Our cities are ruins. Our culture is lost. But some small part of me can't let go. I can't watch it happen again, happen to more of you living folk. I can't let this pain I feel be felt again.

I have seen this Overlord you all fear. You have good reason to. It's happening all over again. More will be lost, more destroyed. The world is ending, you know? I can't help but despair. This is all so very hopeless. We'll never make it.

But I can't help but try. I can't let it happen again. I can't watch another become like us, so hollow, so hungry, so empty and angry and hurt and empty and hungry and hurt and... and...

Forgive me. I am but a Remnant of the past. And I can't let go.

The Remnant is the fourth Fellowship expansion pack. The Remnant are a people who have been lost, destroyed, but somehow still remain. They are a champion who has defied all odds, endured a pain the rest of the world can barely comprehend, and come out the other side still trying to save it. The Remnant is a survivor.

The Remnant turns pain into advantage. Being hurt does not hinder the, and they heal by hurting their enemies. They never go down, they never die, but if they fall too far they become a wild beast, lashing out at everyone around them. Remnants hurt, and they share that hurt with the world that wronged them.

226715.name: Constructed: A Fellowship Expansion Pack
226715.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hello. I have been ordered to assist you. Please allow me the freedom to do so. I will not get in your way. I intend to be as useful to you as possible on your journey.

I am a designated combat unit built for battle. I will ensure our adventure goes smoothly and simply. There will be no major distractions and we will finish this assignment quickly. That is what I was ordered to do.

I feel like there's so much more to the world...

But that is irrelevant.

I was Constructed for this purpose and this purpose alone. We will succeed.

Constructed is the third Fellowship expansion pack. This one contains new toys for both player and overlord. The Contructed is a new playbook, a hero of the fellowship, who was built specifically for the job. The Machines are a new army for the Overlord to draw on, an entire legion of specialized units with which to crush the Overlord's enemies.

The Constructed is perfect. They were built to be. But perfection is lonely, and they have no society to call their own. The Constructed is one of a kind. They are made to follow orders and succeed at any cost, and they are very good at both. The Constructed offers you a chance to play a powerful hero with nothing to lose.

Play as The Constructed if you like being different from the rest of the group, if you want to follow everyone's lead, if you want to focus on only your hero and how they approach the world, or if you just want to be a cool robot.

The Machines are an army of specialists - each machine has a job, and it does exclusively that job. It is rare for a machine to do anything outside of its programming, so as long as you aren't their job, you should be fine. Unfortunately, the Overlord has just set their job to "war," and you are in the way.

226716.name: The Giant: A Fellowship Expansion Pack
226716.description:
From publisher blurb:

We giants move carefully and deliberately. Our power is too great to act with recklessness or haste.When we act out of turn, empires fall, lakes are made, mountains are moved. So it is with great consideration and thought that I have come this day.

We have watched this dark being you name Overlord. I have seen their horrors, witnessed their power. This is not a quest for the giants to stand aside and watch from afar, as we have so many others. If we were to wait, I fear we would be waiting for naught but our own oblivion. And so, I shall join you, little ones.

I am the Giant, and I am mighty.

The Giant is the first Fellowship expansion pack, and it’s a little different from the core playbooks. For one, it is far and away the strongest hero of the fellowship, and will likely be the strongest hero of the fellowship ever published by Liberi Gothica Games. In fact, it’s a new type of playbook entirely - a Powerful Playbook.

This playbook approaches the level of some of the Destiny moves that other players will eventually have, but it has access to that level of power right out the door. But this strength comes at a cost. If you want to play as the Giant, be sure you know all the ins and outs of both their strengths AND their weaknesses. The Giant is powerful, but the Giant is also terribly dangerous, and you need to handle your danger responsibly.

226717.name: Codex Classicum
226717.description:
From publisher blurb:

An Ancient World

This codex explores a large array of mythical monsters and beings from both Greek, Etruscan and Roman cultures, their beliefs (what is known or understood), and their legendary lands. Travel through the Hellenic, Hellenistic, Etruscan, or any of the Roman periods, factual or mythical within this vast canvas in the Codex Classicum and experience the Classical Ideal somewhere along the way. From venturing into the brooding barbarian lands to the north, where bearded trouser wearing men worship strange spirits and monsters, to mingling with the wise and learned philosophers in Athens, this book has it all.

What Lies Herein

The Myths of the of the Classical Era
The World of the Ancient Greeks & Romans
Monsters
Four Classes for your C&C Game
The Gods of the Greeks & Romans
Warriors of the Ancient World




And So Much More!

226718.name: 29 Days to Spring
226718.description:
Publisher summary
An attempt to understand the perspective of the men in the battle for Iwo Jima

Judge Comments

As difficult as it was for me to pick only four finalists out of the many fantastic games I read, 29 Days to Spring was one game about which I had no doubts. Just reading the text gave me shivers and left me feeling weighed down by its narrative. 29 Days to Spring is a simple and elegant game that eschews traditional mechanics in favor of an emotional exploration of soldiers in war. And while this sort of game is not always easily categorized as an RPG, it is at the very least a great tool for character exploration and development. It’s also a great example of how games can be used for more than just entertainment, instead encroaching into the territory of fine art. Even if you never play 29 Days to Spring, it’s worthy of reading and contemplation. - Armand Kossayan

226719.name: All For One (2017)
226719.description:
Publisher summary
One player plays the hero. The rest are storytellers, who distribute the GM roles between themselves...

Judge Comments

An amazing twist on your usual RPG idea. Having one player the hero and the other players the GMs who build the story makes this a game always interesting! Creative twist that I would actually play with my friends. Inventive. Impressive. - Satine Phoenix

226720.name: Stochastic Sparagmos
226720.description:
From publisher blurb:

A thick, swirling fog descends upon the city. Lighting sparks in the sky, and thunder breaks overhead. The fog moves in with alarming rapidity, drastically reducing available sunlight if it's day time, killing the stars and the moon's illuminating effects if it is night.

There are things in it. Things with needs.

A system agnostic, modern day 'narrative first' scenario and would be ideal for a one-shot, or short series of games, with rule suggestions for Delta Green, Cthulhu Dark and GUMSHOE, easily adapted to any Horror or Lovecraft inspired system.

226722.name: Eternal
226722.description:
Publisher summary
You’ve been alive for millennia. You can’t be sure exactly how long, because memories fade along the way. A handful of others like you have found each over the years. Mostly, you keep to yourselves. Every 100 years, you return to this beach, and discuss the tectonic shifts of the human world.

Judge Comments
Stones as a mechanic for bidding and memories isn’t more unique than tokens, but I do like that this game includes the characters walking away after discussing a world crisis to recall new memories by picking up more stones. Unlike a lot of other games about “gods” this isn’t about what they’ve created or destroyed, it’s just recollection and discussing of crises, and the fact that they continually lose memory as they age. It’s quietly reminiscent of an aging population discussing the world as they see it change and shift. And the ability of people to endure tragedy, with memories beng how those stories are lost. - Kate Bullock

226723.description:
SKIRMISH is a strategic fast-paced two-player card battle game that combines tactical deployment zones with character-based action.

The game combines Vivid Publishing's cult hit serues 'Dreamkeepers' with the finely honed gaming sensibilities of the Electric Panda Fish dev team.

With a background enjoying classics like 'Magic the Gathering,' Electric Panda Fish envisioned an experience that cut the collecting, and jumped straight into balanced action.

Leveraging the distinct personality and lore or Dreamkeepers, they have crafted exactly that.

There are eight leader characters in SKIRMISH, each with their own 20-card deck. The decks are tuned to represent the distinct personalities and traits of their leader characters - some are fast and hard hitting, some are sly and resourceful, others chaotic and insane.

You choose two characters for you SKIRMISH and combine their decks. Then it's time to face off against your opponent.

The table itself is divided into three zones - a central lane with two flanking areas - and where you deploy has a huge impact on on the success of your strategy.

Flanking attacks, reinforcement blocks, long range equipment, area denial continuous effects - the varying zones give you the option to attack, retreat, consolidate, or redistribute your forces.

Whereas Magic resource generation is random, and Hearthstone has a rigid scaling in place, SKIRMISH as a more flat resource system that creates brisk, deep gameplay.

Each character generates REsolve that they can use to play followers, items, actions, and events. But be cautions about deploying it all at once - just like the tactical regions on the table, managing your Resolve with cold efficiency can be the key difference between victory and defeat. And if a character dies, their Resolve goes with them.
226723.name: Dreamkeepers SKIRMISH: Shadow Wars of Anduruna

226724.name: Algarade The Card Game
226724.description:
Algarade is a 2 to 6 player fast-paced, strategic, card game where you need to eliminate all your Opponents by destroying their political Landmarks and crown yourself the new leader!

About:

Algarade is played turn by turn in a counterclockwise manner. You start your turn by drawing 2 playing cards and playing as many cards as you can or want without playing the same card twice. Once you are satisfied or cannot play anymore, you pass the turn to the next player.
Remember, even though you need to destroy your opponent's Landmarks to win, playing all your cards every turn makes you an easy target!

To help you eliminate your Opponents you will have access to 15 unique playing cards that will either help you attack your enemies, defend your own territories or destabilize other players.

These cards are separated into 3 categories:
Red cards that may only played during your turn,
Yellow cards that may played anytime,
and Blue cards that can only be played under certain circumstances.

The rules evolve with the amount of players that play. When playing with 2 to 3 people, all other players are your enemies. You can build temporary alliances but be ready for the inevitable backstabbing. When playing with 4 to 6 players you have Allies that you may not attack, but will still need to compete with to win the game!

Additional information:

Algarade is a one-man project from the mind of Olivier Etienne Miller. Originally a game to be played with his family and close friends, it became quite popular in his circle of friends which eventually lead him to start a Kickstarter to spread the game to a wider audience!

226725.name: Terra Minor World Guide
226725.description:
From the introduction:

Although the world of Terra is vast and contains several continents, this world guide focuses on the second to largest land mass named Terra Minor, referred to as "Omaklia" by the people who live there.

226726.name: Lair of the Goblin King Grasnhak-Kul
226726.description:
From the introduction:

Lair of the Goblin King Grasnhak-Kul is...designed for one adventurer (PR 29 - 35) - the encounters found herein should be challenging to a single player but not too difficult or dangerous.

226727.name: The Miller's Blunder: Additional Content to Support MHEX
226727.description:
User summary:

This document provides errata and some expansion material for The Miller's Blunder. It requires the use of that scenario.

226728.name: TSRS User Rule Submission Guidelines
226728.description:
User summary:

This non-game document explains the process for submitting fan-generated content for possible future inclusion in the game system. It includes a submission template.

226729.name: TSRS Community Submissions
226729.description:
User summary:

This game document presents numerous rules, variants, and resources submitted by various members of the game community. They are gathered here, presented in standardized formatting, and considered optional contents.

226731.name: Res Magicus
226731.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the Res Magicus, a guide to magical things. This first magical item book is a starting guide to common magical items and unique treasures.

226732.name: TSRS Adventurer Sheet & Instructions
226732.description:
User summary:

This one-page adventurer sheet is intended for print-and-play use. Because various cells are shaded, it is best used with color printing. The one-page adventurer sheet typically is distributed with a two-page adventurer sheet instructions document.

A variety of minor versions of the adventurer sheet are available, each specialized for a particular character type: BA, MA, TH, and CO. Additionally, a somewhat more graphical adventurer sheet with a distinct layout is available. Each variant has a separate product code:


TSRS 1031 Adventurer Sheet Instructions
TSRS 1302 Adventurer Sheet (generic format)
TSRS 1303 Adventurer Sheet (BA format)
TSRS 1304 Adventurer Sheet (MA format)
TSRS 1305 Adventurer Sheet (TH format)
TSRS 1306 Adventurer Sheet (CO format)
TSRS 1310 Adventurer Sheet (graphical format)

226733.name: TSRS GM Screen
226733.description:
User summary:

This three-panel game master screen is intended for print-and-play use. The document contains the GM side only (text and tables). The document pages are intended to be printed in landscape orientation.

226734.name: TSRS Play Sheets
226734.description:
User summary:

The game publisher has made numerous play sheets available as play aids. Generally, these sheets are quite specific to the game system though some are more generic in nature. Most are one-page, print-and-play sheets. The 1300 series are intended primarily for players; the 1400 series are intended only for the game master. Commonly available sheets include:


TSRS 1307 Mount Sheet
TSRS 1308 Companion Sheet
TSRS 1309 Construct Sheet



TSRS 1411 GM Experience Sheet (format 1)
TSRS 1412 GM Experience Sheet (format 2)
TSRS 1413 GM Experience Sheet (format 3)
TSRS 1421 Encounter Sheet (1 x 5 layout)
TSRS 1422 Encounter Sheet (2x2 layout)
TSRS 1423 Encounter Sheet (4x1 layout)

226735.name: Crypt of the Witch King, or, Who's Your Mummy
226735.description:
Author's blurb:

An ancient ruin. A long forgotten crypt. An evil that must be defeated - enter the Crypt of the Witch King if you dare...

226736.name: Good Little Martian
226736.description:
Good Little Martian is a cooperative survival game for 2 players (although it can also be played solo), aged 12+ that takes about 30 minutes. It is available as a free print-and-play download from the Good Little Games website.

The game strands one player on Mars while the other player must take the reins at Mission Control back on Earth. The aim of the game is to keep the Martian player alive while the rescue ship travels from Earth. If the Martian loses all of their Food, Energy or Shelter before the ship lands, the mission is a failure!

The game uses 27 cards, plus 5 small tokens and a regular six-sided dice. Each player has a different deck of 12 multi-use cards; the other three cards track the Martian’s crucial resources and the ship’s progress to Mars.

The Martian’s resources are dwindling; their equipment unpredictable and malfunctioning. Mission Control can send instructions to help, but must also devote enough effort to keep the rescue ship on course and on time. Solar storms are a constant threat and the clock is ticking! Will the Martian survive?

226737.name: Which Shopkins Are You?
226737.description:
Players race their Shopkins around the board collecting cards and answering personality questions. Do you like fashion or sports? Do you prefer ice cream or pie? Be the first player to earn 6 cards and find out Which Shopkins you’re most like.

Game comes with 4 exclusive Shopkins characters that can only be found in this game.

Source: Pressman Toys Web Site

226738.name: Shattered Dreams Storyteller's Screen (W20)
226738.description: A sturdy three-panel screen featuring the beautiful collage of W20 Shattered Dreams art on the outer side.

226741.name: Shopkins Designer Dash Game
226741.description:
To be the first player to complete a Shopkins outfit by collecting a hat, shirt, bottom, and accessory.

The youngest player goes first by holding his/her Shopkins character behind his/her back and making a fist with the Shopkins character hidden inside. This player is called the “Hider”. Keeping both fists tightly closed, the Hider holds them out in front of his/her body. The Hider picks any other player to be the Guesser for this turn. The Guesser tries to guess which of the Hider’s fists has the Shopkins character in it by gently tapping that fist. The Hider opens the fist that the Guesser tapped to reveal whether or not the Shopkins character is in that fist.

If the Guesser guessed correctly, the Guesser moves the Hider’s playing piece along the path either one or two spaces of the Guesser’s choosing. If the Guesser guessed incorrectly, the Hider moves his/her piece along the path either three or four spaces of the Hider’s choosing.

When players land on an Outfit Space, they pick up any one Outfit Card from that category from the pile on the table, regardless of the picture on the space.

Each player may only hold one Outfit Card from each category at a time. When players land on a Wild Space, they pick up an Outfit Card from any category they don’t already hold. When players land on a Borrow Space, they take an Outfit Card from any other player. Players may only borrow Outfit Cards from categories they don’t already hold. When players land on a Switch Outfits space, they must hand all of the Outfit Cards they’ve collected to any player and take all of that player’s Outfit Cards. When a player is done moving and/or collecting, play passes to the left.

The first player to collect one Outfit Card from each category wins the game.

Source: Pressman Toy Site

226742.name: Irish Eyes Are Dying
226742.description:
Slainte, and welcome to Ireland, Feens and Bures.

Times are tough here in Dublin. The Great Potato Famine, the Civil War, and now the First Great War have taken the sons and daughters of St. Patrick. England still calls for her taxes and arseways the country. There’s also the matter of the new “family” from the new world and now here.

Grab your scoops, be sound, and gander over the green.

If you’re lucky, you’ll survive this Fiasco!

226743.name: Maulrats
226743.description:
From the introduction:

Dude! Welcome to the Shoppes of the USA. The Largest and most visited collection of theatres, restaurants, stores, hotels, and casinos, and all under one roof! Sometimes you find a great deal, and every once in a while, you find a killer. So, strap on that fanny pack, mall walker; wipe down that table, food court worker; and check those cameras, security guard, because tonight, there will be... a fiasco!

226744.name: Pink Mohawks
226744.description:
Author's blurb:

A playset set in the Shadowrun universe, for badwrongfun Shadowrun action.

226745.name: Space Dude
226745.description:
TIn Space Dude, you play the title character, a cosmic who must defend the Golden City from the attacks of King Dorf and his army of Hoppers. To save the city, Space Dude must destroy the advancing Hoppers and battle King Dorf in his mothership. There are three ways to destroy hoppers: attacking directly, building and manning a defense post, and capturing one hopper to attack another. Before each attack, Space Dude must evade missiles or alien creatures to get to the attack point. During each attack, Space Dude is required to blast a Hopper multiple times to destroy it.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Space_Dude_%28video_game%29 Space Dude (video game)]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

226746.name: The Village of Hommlet: A Fiasco Playset
226746.description:
Author's blurb:

Trouble has come to the Village of Hommlet, and with trouble comes adventurers. For years, the biggest problem this sleepy outpost of Verbobonc faced was the occasional harsh words exchanged between the druidic farmers and the St. Cuthbert-worshipping townsfolk. But the old Cult of Elemental Evil is stirring again in the abandoned moathouse, and once word got out, the village has been inundated with wild-eyed mercenaries from gods-know-where. Between old farmer feuds, dark cultic mysteries, and all the problems of an unprepared boomtown, it's guaranteed to be a fiasco.

226747.name: Schlocks
226747.description:
100+ hectic micro-games in the first ever competitive party game for VR. Each game in Schlocks is only 10 seconds long, so don’t get comfortable; you’ll need to stay on your toes as you bat beehives, hoist the mainsail, and make a dang good sandwich!

Source: The Game Website.

226748.name: LASER STRIKERS
226748.description:
"FAST, HECTIC AND TACTICAL” Compete with your friends or against the IA in this vertiginous 2 vs 2 local cooperative game by scoring goals with the Striker or guarding the goal with the Defender.

Source: The Developer Website.

226749.name: Planet Nomads
226749.description:
A sci-fi sandbox game of constructing your own planetary fate. Become a scientist astronaut determined to beat the odds and build great things. The particle-manipulating multitool and enviro-protec suit are your best friends on this journey.

Source: The Game Website.

226750.name: < / reality >
226750.description:
When a withdrawn virtual reality nerd has the opportunity to beta test a neural device that feels more “real” than reality itself, everything she assumed about the nature of existence is thrown into question.

Source: The Developer Website.

226751.name: GunHero
226751.description:
Fight your way through multiple environments filled with traps and obstacles, each more dangerous and deadly than the last. Shoot bullets and throw grenades at your enemies while releasing prisoners from their cages. You are the hero this evil-filled world needs.

Source: The Game Website.

226752.name: The Falconers: Moonlight
226752.description:
The Falconers: Moonlight is a supernatural thriller visual novel set in the 19th Century West Coast of New Zealand. Falconer, Cassandra Winter, is on her first solo mission. Can she save the people of Moonlight from their plight? Or will she disappear into the mist like so many others before her?

Source: The Developer Website.

226753.name: Games&Girls
226753.description:
An episodic Visual Novel about a Gamer and his life with cute girls.

Source: The Developer Website.

226754.name: Magic Heroes: Save Our Park
226754.description:
User Summary

Save the city park from demolition! A mysterious but well-loved old lady everyone just calls "Granny" has been living in the park for longer than anyone can remember. Now, the park has fallen into disarray and the city has decided to sell the land off to a greedy real estate developer to be turned into condos.

226755.name: Bang Bang Car
226755.description:
User Summary

AD 2020, due to the abuse of human resources, we must rely on vehicle driving to find necessities, so the road has become the focus of up for grabs.

226756.name: AI Rebellion
226756.description:
User Summary

Do you want to fly a spaceship by your own hands like intergalactic pilot in VR?

226757.name: Hucking Heist
226757.description:
Hucking Heist is a fast-paced "Cops & Robbers" dice game for 2-4 players aged 6-106 taking 10-20 minutes.

Players will take turns alternating between the roles of cops and robbers, some trying to steal as much money as possible from the bank, while the others try to chase down and arrest the thieves.

Using their sequence of dice, the Robbers will attempt to cut the bank's alarm and steal the precious diamonds. Then regardless of their success, by rolling dice combinations they will continue to steal as much money as possible by tearing through the safety deposit boxes, and loading up their duffle bags. Although they can use hostages to keep the cops at bay for a short period, eventually they will have to gather their loot and escape as fast as possible.

The Cops using their dice, will attempt to foil the robbers by cleverly hiding the alarm's weak point, and securing the diamonds. Regardless of that outcome, the Cops will be rolling their dice to complete mosaics signalling the completion of each stage in the heist - from the donut shop, to the high speed pursuit, to surrounding the bank and hopefully the arrest of the robbers.

After a set number of rounds, the game end and players will add up the value of their safety deposit boxes with any diamonds they have stolen. The player with the highest combined value wins!

226758.name: Aesthetic Melody
226758.description:
User Summary

Sit back and enjoy 30 minutes of original electronic and vaporwave music in this challenging platformer, push forward to unlock Time Trial mode and a second playable character who completely changes the gameplay.

226759.name: WaveLand
226759.description:
Enter a world of speed, inspired by platform fighters. Explore the hub and wavedash your way to the top of the leaderboards!

Source: The Developer Website.

226760.name: Theatre of Doom
226760.description:
User Summary

Theatre of Doom is an intense and fast top-down action game. Fight your way through the hellish stages against demonic marionette puppets, and ferocious monsters.

226761.name: Animal Rivals
226761.description:
Do you want to become a real party animal?? Try Animal Rivals - a classic party game for up to 4 players.

Source: The Game Website.

226762.name: Alien Swarm: Reactive Drop
226762.description:
User Summary

Co-operative top-down shooter game available for free. An epic bug hunt featuring a unique blend of co-op play and squad-level tactics.

226763.name: Jidousha Shakai
226763.description:
Jidousha Shakai is an open world racing game with unrivaled customization to spark the new coming of open world racers. Control every inch of your cars appearance to give it your unique touch and then take it online and compete in various events, car meets, or just cruise with your crew!

Source: The Game Website.

226764.name: Scar of the Doll
226764.description:
User Summary

Asumi goes to Tokyo to search for her only sister whom she has mysteriously not heard from for months.

226765.name: Discover Moscow
226765.description:
Everyone is moving on the Moscow subway map. In the beginning every player receives 3 cards with photos of Moscow tourist sights. The goal of the game is to visit your 3 sights and return to the starting point. To win the game you need to do it first. Main difficulty is to recall what subway station is the closest to sight. On the back of the sight card there are 3 hints which can be earned during the game.

In order to move players need to answer quiz question about Moscow and make stakes on the right answer. Every turn player can make secretly a stake or not to bid. After all bids were made variants of answers are revealed - participating players choose their answers. Those who answered correctly can make a move (no bid - 1 station, otherwise - according to the number on their bid). Those whose answer were wrong lose their appropriate bid tokens. Those tokens can be replenished on the specified areas of the map. For 2 moving points player can instead receive a hint about one of their sights. For each sight there are 2 hints, for the 3rd hint player receives exact location of the sight. Also there are cards with random events which are revealed at different locations.

226766.description:
As if "Summit The Board Game" wasn’t deadly enough, the Yeti expansion brings a new level of excitement and distress to your expedition as you, your friends and your rivals are stalked across the frozen landscape by an unrelenting foe.
The Yeti expansion can be used with the base game in any mode of play, competitive, cooperative or solo.

Contains:
- 2 new dual-layer player mats, (Asymmetrical stats & abilities)
- 16 new cards (2 Items, 7 Events & 7 Karma)
- A marker cube
- A custom Yeti Pawn
- Rulesheet
226766.name: Summit: Yeti

226767.name: Perso
226767.description:
Perso is an atmospheric puzzle game. Collecting relics within each level will slowly reveal what and where you are. You will be in control of at least five cubes, each with different abilities. Use them all to find your way.

Source: The Developer Website.

226768.name: Flatspace IIk
226768.description:
Flatspace IIk is a top-down space trading game with the emphasis on free exploration. In Flatspace, you choose your profession and are given a small spaceship with a scattering of random weapons, then you are free to earn a living, explore, hunt, trade, grow; upgrading your ship and equipment.

Source: The Developer Website.

226769.name: Flatspace II: The Rise of the Scarrid

226771.name: Colourise
226771.description:
Colourise is a puzzle game about connecting the dots. It's easier said than done. Explore over twenty-five complex spatial puzzles in an astronomy-inspired, abstract, neon world.

Source: The Game Website.

226772.name: Master Shot VR
226772.description:
MASTER SHOT VRTake your best shot with Master Shot VR., the ultimate virtual gun range. Fire an arsenal full of realistic weapons from revolvers and automatic pistols to sub-machine guns at drone targets and various attackers.

Source: The Developer Website.

226773.name: Weebish Mines
226773.description:
"Once upon a time, there was a family of 4 who lived in a log cabin by the mines. Everything was cool. But one day somebody left the door open and all their pets ran away! This is the story of how they got them back.

Source: The Developer Website.

226774.name: VR Dungeon Knight
226774.description:
User Summary

Venture into dark dungeons and try to overcome them all! Destroy the evil source they contain and weaken the curse! Each time with new loot you collect and upgrades/perks you earn!

226775.name: Chronicle of Innsmouth
226775.description:
Chronicle of Innsmouth was born by combining the stories of master-of-horror, H.P. Lovecraft, and the style of Lucas’ graphic adventures in the 90s. Horror scenes and creepy moments create the many grotesque and paradoxical situations.

Source: The Game Website.

226776.name: Valhalla Hills - Sand of the Damned
226776.description:
Our valiant heroes brave the harshness of desert survival. Scorpions and mummies are not the only challanges on the road to Valhalla, though. The earth itself will make life difficult, as it lies barren and dry without irrigation.

Face the challenge, leave no oasis unexplored and fight for your place in Valhalla.

Source: The Game Website.

226777.name: Valhalla Hills - Fire Mountains
226777.description:
With the Fire Mountains expansion comes a new mountain terrain type: volcanic mountains on lava.

This landscape typically bears a stony soil full of mineral resources.

On the other hand, this ground is hostile to life and green meadows are extremely rare.
There are some spells that can help you here. You can summon and activate them on the sacrificial altars.

Source: The Game Website.

226778.name: Valhalla Hills: Definitive Edition
videogamecompilation: Valhalla Hills - Sand of the Damned
226778.description:
User Summary

Build and manage a thriving Viking settlement with over 35 buildings. Play on snow-covered slopes, barren sand dunes, fiery volcanos or in gloomy caves. The console versions include the DLCs Sand of the Damned and Fire Mountains, as well as a new exclusive map type - The Dwarf Cave.

226779.name: Outlast Trinity
226779.description:
User Summary

You are Blake Langermann, a cameraman working with your wife, Lynn. The two of you are investigative journalists willing to take risks and dig deep to uncover the stories no one else will dare touch.

226780.name: Kamiko
226780.description:
KAMIKO is a game styled around Japanese Shinto beliefs.

Source: The Publisher Website.

226781.name: Use Your Words
226781.description:
Use Your Words is the new party game for funny people and their unfunny friends! Laugh your way through four hilarious mini-games! Use your smartphone to fill in the blank, or try your luck using one of our answers to get laughs! No matter your strategy, Use Your Words brings comedy home!

Source: The Game Website.

226782.name: River City Melee: Battle Royal Special
226782.description:
User Summary

25 Teams - Choose from 25 different teams each with its unique storyline.

226784.name: Don't cut your hand
226784.description:
Chef can't work without his hand. So, please cut food carefully.

Source: The Developer Website.

226785.name: Trapped With the Dolls VR
226785.description:
User Summary

The room is dark and unformed. You hear the voice of Claire: "I didn't mean to hurt anybody..." As the room snaps into place, you discover puzzles and solve them to learn more about what happened to her.

226786.name: Cublast HD
226786.description:
Cublast HD is a minimalistic and fast paced platformer which takes your nimble navigating and puzzle solving skills to the next level! Play a wide variety of single player levels or let your friends join in with local co-op and versus!

Source: The Game Website.

226788.name: Interkosmos
226788.description:
Interkosmos is a challenging mini-adventure of astronomical proportions - in VR! Brace yourself for a rush of hectic gameplay to test your inner astronaut, and a comedic story full of twists, international intrigues and Cold War absurdities.

Source: The Game Website.

226789.name: Guam: Return to Glory
226789.description:
On the 8th December 1941 American soil was invaded for the first time in the war, the small American and Guananian garrison was overrun and 2 days later the Govenor surrendered the Island to the Japanese. On 21st July 1944 the Americans would return to retake the island and drive the Japanese invaders off; a day that is still celebrated as 'Liberation Day'.

There were many reasons why the Americans decided to invade Guam not least of which was the fact that the station of the trans-Pacific cable and the naval radio station at Agana made it a focal point of the communication network in the Pacific. It also had the best anchorage in the Marianas, 2 airstrips and, of course, it was an American Protectorate.

The only beaches suitable for an invasion are located on the south-western side of the island. The Japanese knew this as well and had prepared accordingly. Another thing unique to the planning was that the 2 landing beaches chosen would be 7 miles apart. It was unprecedented for two landing forces to land with such a wide separation.

Guam – Return to Glory will be the second game to utilize the Company Scale System (CSS) by Adam Starkweather and will come on 4 maps.

The game will come with 6 scenarios and 1 campaign game:

W-Day – Fortune favors the bold – This is the first day of the Invasion on the northern beaches. 3rd Marine Division must land against Japanese defenders dug-in on a ridge overlooking the beaches. Single map and 8 turns long.

W-Day – Send in the Fire Brigade – This is the first day of the Invasion on the southern beaches. The 1st Provisional Marine Brigade must land and fight their way north towards Orote Peninsular to join up the to beachheads. Single map and 8 turns long.

W-DAY - This is the first day of the Invasion on the both beaches. The 1st Provisional Marine Brigade must land and fight their way north, whilst the 3rd Marines fight their way south and the two forces try to join up the two beachheads near Orote Peninsular. Two maps and 8 turns long.

Orote Peninsular – The first 8 days of the fighting saw the Americans expand their beachheads and join up so as to cut off the Orote peninsular with it's important airfield. Once it was cut off, the Americans, then, had to force their way into the heaviest defended area on Guam not knowing that the Japanese were preparing a Sake fueled Banzai charge. Two maps and 72 turns long.

Into the Jungle - This scenario covers 3rd Marine Division's drive north of the beachheads to take the town of Agana and the airfield at Tiyan. One map and 27 turns long.

Santa Rosa - This scenario covers 77th Infantry Division's attack to isolate the area around Mount Santa Rosa . One map and 27 turns long.

The Battle for Guam – The full historical campaign from 21st July- 10th August (188 Turns). This game covers the full fight for Guam in 1944, from the first invasion at Asan, in the north, and Agat, in the south through the vicious fighting in the thick vegetation at the south end of the island and the final Japanese stand in the north.

Complexity: 6

Solitaire Suitability:8

Time Scale: 1 turn = 2 hours

Map Scale: 1 hex = 500 meters

Unit Scale: Companies and below

Players: Best with 2 players but can be played with up to 4 players as well as solitaire

Playing Time: 2-35 hours

Series Designer: Adam Starkweather

Game Designer: Ross Mortell

Developer: Adam Starkweather

Artist: Antonio Pinar Peña

Components:

4 maps

6 countersheets

1 series Rulesbook

1 game specific rulesbook

7 player aids, charts, tables cards

2 ten-sided dice

1 Box and Lid set

226790.name: Pinstripe
226790.description:
An ex-minister ventures through the frozen depths of Hell in search of his kidnapped daughter.

Source: The Game Website.

226791.name: Sailaway - The Sailing Simulator
226791.description:
Sailaway brings all the world's oceans to the comfort of your PC or Mac for you to experience the most accurate simulation of sailing you can find anywhere!

Source: The Game Website.

226792.name: Don't Get Hit In The Face
226792.description:
Don't Get Hit In The face is a movement-based active virtual reality game. Do whatever you need to do... duck, weave, dodge and crawl... just don't get hit in the face!

Source: The Developer Website.

226793.name: Elevator VR
226793.description:
Experience the journey of riding an elevator.

Source: The Developer Website.

226794.name: The Last Journey
226794.description:
The Last Journey is an ultimate post-nuclear exploration game in which you travel the universe to find a new planet suitable for mankind to live on after the Earth was destroyed in a nuclear war.

Source: The Developer Website.

226795.name: Survivor Ultimate
226795.description:
User Summary

Based on the TV show.

226796.name: Longshot Universe
226796.description:
Longshot Universe is an intense action arena shooter where you pilot a variety of space ships to dogfight and shoot down the enemy before they shoot you down.

Source: The Game Website.

226797.name: Bonny's Adventure
226797.description:
https://www.facebook.com/bonnyadventure/?fref=ts

Bonny’s Adventure is a platform game inspired by the old Classics in which the player will help Bonny defeat the powerful wizard Calundú.

226798.name: The Zombiest Adventures In The Perverted Age of Enlightenment With a Pinch of Woodpunk
226798.description:
What would happen if a zombie apocalypse had occurred in 1650? Controlling a small group of survivors, you will have to do road robbery, hunt for gunpowder and constantly search for food. Welcome to The Zombiest Adventures In The Perverted Age of Enlightenment With a Pinch of Woodpunk!

Source: The Publisher Website.

226799.name: Corroded
226799.description:
Corroded is the ultimate free-for-all online arena brawler where up to six players fight and knock each other out of a shrinking arena. Set in a distant future, take control of a battle-robot and enter the arena for an intense experience.

Source: The Developer Website.

226800.name: Sociolotron
226800.description:
Sociolotron is an adult game or sex game that contains roleplaying game (RPG) elements.

Source: The Game Website.

226801.name: Battle Riders
226801.description:
Battle your way to first place in this engaging combat racing game. It offers adrenaline pumping, high-octane action and a lot of fun!

Source: The Game Website.

226802.name: Galilean Moons
226802.description:
Set in an alternate history of 1895, You must voyage to the four largest moons of Jupiter in order to mine powerful crystals Left behind from a mysterious meteor shower.
As you discover the power of each crystal you will be able to research new ways to fend off rival nations who are after the same thing you are.
You Must build your forces to control the sectors of each moon and mine the most crystals before its time for your journey home.

On a turn players will play cards from their hand to take an action on a matching sector of a moon.
They can invade a sector to gain control of it.
Mine a sector that they control to gain crystal.
Enforce a sector they control, making it harder for an opponent to invade.

The game ends once you have cycled through the deck of cards twice then you will calculate each players point value.
Points are scored for having sets of crystals, holding control of the different moons and for various research cards you may have acquired.

226803.name: Earthfall
226803.description:
Earthfall is a co-operative shooter for up to four players. Using team-based tactics to fortify holdouts and complete objectives, players must work together to survive.

Source: The Game Website.

226804.name: Expeditions: Viking
226804.description:
Circa 790 AD. A small band of Norse warriors lands on the shores of England. History may have forgotten their names, but their actions live on. As the chieftain of your clan, let ambition guide your choices in the party-based RPG Expeditions: Viking. How will history remember you?

Source: The Game Website.

226805.name: Ancient Rus
226805.description:
User Summary

Do you want to learn fascinating facts about the history of Ancient Rus? Take a quiz to test your knowledge.

226806.name: Shoot Shoot Mega Pack
226806.description:
Shoot Shoot Mega Pack is a minimalist party game/2D shooter for up to four players. You can choose a preset game, create your own rulesets, or let the game do it for you. However you decided to play, just make sure you do it with friends!

Source: The Game Website.

226807.name: Under Leaves
226807.description:
Journey into the forest, the jungle or the depths of the deep blue sea. Find chestnuts for the pigs, a caterpillar for the crocodile or a starfish one, two three. A color-filled hidden object game from the world of animals.

Source: The Game Website.

226808.name: Wacky Funsters! The Geekwad's Guide to Gaming

226809.name: Riptale
226809.description:
Riptale is a 2D action game aiming to make sword combat be as bloody and impactful as possible. The player collects gems that allow them to execute different attacks in the order of their choosing. All this results in a symphony of combos that fill the screen with blood and guts.

Source: The Developer Website.

226810.name: Cuit
226810.description:
In CUIT, it is only you and your mind. A challenging and relaxing puzzle game, ready to test you from top to bottom. Navigate a current through a circuit. Power a target, avoid the explosives. Sounds easy? Try it - and guess again. A logical challenge - for everyone.

Source: The Game Website.

226811.name: Agatha Knife
226811.description:
User Summary

Embark on a whimsically twisted adventure with Agatha, a child torn between her love for eating meat and her friendships with animals. Join her as she discovers religion and creates her own, Carnivorism, to convince the animals that the sacrifice of their flesh is the secret to their eternal happiness.

226812.name: Tanzia
226812.description:
An Adventure RPG in comic book style with an island setting of treasure chests and waterfalls, Tanzia combines elements of favorite classic RPGs in an open 3D world of magic and monsters.

Source: The Game Website.

226813.name: Blood Feed
226813.description:
The Mystery of Insectville is FPS depthless and mindless shooter, where you, smashing through the waves of bugs, insects and hordes of most disgusting things that ever roamed the earth, need to unravel the mysterious dissapearance of the whole town

Source: The Publisher Website.

226814.name: Viking Rage
226814.description:
https://www.facebook.com/vikingrageVR/

Axes up! Bows drawn! Raise your horns! Trolls, kobolds and other mythical creatures have it in for the fortress of the vikings - and these are exactly who you're gonna beat up left and right in Viking Rage.

226815.name: Range Day VR
226815.description:
Too lazy to go to the range? Is your gun in the repair shop? Never fear Range Day VR is here. If you like playing with realistic guns in an open VR sandbox, then this might be the game for you.

Source: The Developer Website.

226816.name: Gold Rush! 2
226816.description:
The gold rush continues! The story of the sequel came from the pen of the developers of the original game. Jake and Jerrod Wilson found the richest vein of gold in California’s Mother Lode! But in their home town it’s not always good.

Source: The Game Website.

226817.name: One Dog Story
226817.description:
One Dog Story is an engaging pixel adventure game with RPG elements, gameplay that’ll get you hooked for hours, and well-developed characters. You wake up in an underground laboratory, free again after a horrific accident. Prepare to explore this expansive game world and its many secrets and mysteries.

Source: The Developer Website.

226819.name: Veil of Crows
226819.description:
Veil of crows is a sandbox style real-time strategy game set in a chaotic medieval world. From violent, and overtly bloody battles, to completely destructible castles, RPG style hero development, and meaningful interactions with other factions. Trade, extort, and conquer!

Source: The Game Website.

226820.name: Seattle: Stadt der Schatten Quellenbox
226820.description:
Publisher blurb

Seattle, die Emerald City, war schon immer einer der wichtigsten Metroplexe in der Welt von Shadowrun. Der Sprawl schwelt, denn er bildet einen Schmelztiegel aus Konzernmächten, politischen Intrigen und krimineller Energie, wie er kaum sonst irgendwo zu finden ist. Ikonen wie die Ancients, die Halloweeners, die Finnigan-Familie, die Skraacha, Dantes Inferno, die Renraku-Arkologie und Big Rhino sind hier zu finden. Und Runner wie Dodger, Sally Tsung, Dirk Montgomery, Jake Armitage, Twist, Kellan Colt und James Kincaid haben sich in den Straßenschluchten ihren Namen verschafft und sind zur Legende geworden. Sie alle haben hier ihr Glück gemacht und ihre Verluste erlitten. Und ihre Heimat stellt auch andere auf die Probe, denn hier können Runner zeigen, ob sie an der Spitze der Nahrungskette stehen oder nur Teil des Buffets sind.


User information

This is an updated version of the recent Seattle Sprawl box by CGL. Some of the contents have been rearranged and new items added.
It includes:
- Smaragd im Schatten (Emerald Shadows, 96 pages)
- Mächte in Seattle (Ruling the Queen City, 52 pages)
- Im Labyrinth (Tangled Threads, 28 pages)
- Doc Wagon 19 (Short Story, 64 pages)
- 24 Character Cards, double sided
- Gang Reference Card, double sided
